quizQuestions.question: Xerxes THE GREAT was king of Persia from 486-465 B.C. He was also known by the Hebrew name Ahasuerus (a-haz-u-e'rus). Who was his first queen?
In the third year of his reign, Xerxes became very angry with the Queen. Why?

answers.a: She instigated a rebellion in the harem
answers.b: She refused to worship the Persian gods
answers.c: She refused to exhibit herself to his male guests
answers.d: She refused to bow to him

quizQuestions.question: All agreed that the queen must be punished. What bad thing would happen if the queen got away with her crime?

answers.a: The women of the kingdom, following her example would refuse to obey their husbands
answers.b: The persian gods would be offended
answers.c: The noblemen of the kingdom would rebel against Xerxes
answers.d: The king's other wives, following her example would refuse to obey the king

quizQuestions.question: The queen was forever banned from the king's presence, and a search was begun for a new queen. Why did Cerxes choose Esther as his queen?

answers.a: Esther's older cousin, Mordecai was very wealthy and had gained the king's favour
answers.b: The king's advisors consulted the stars and found that Esther was destined to be queen
answers.c: The king ordered all the most beautiful women of the kingdom to be brought to his harem so he could choose a new queen. Esther was his favorite
answers.d: The king saw Esther bathing one day while he was on the roof of the palace, and ordered her to be brought to his harem

quizQuestions.question: What secret did Esther keep from the king?

answers.b: She was in love with Mordecai

quizQuestions.question: Some time later, Xerxes promoted Haman, one of his nobles, to the highest position in the land. Haman maneuvered the king into issuing an edict that all the Jews in the kingdom will be killed. Why did Haman want to kill the Jews?

answers.a: Haman was a Philistine, and they always hated the Jews.
answers.b: Mordecai refused to pay taxes to him
answers.c: Mordecai refused to kneel down before him
answers.d: The Jews had opposed Haman's appointment

quizQuestions.question: How did Esther thwart Haman's plot?

answers.a: She skillfully convinced the king of Haman's evil nature
answers.b: She bribed Haman to abandon his plot
answers.c: She convinced Hamn;s wife to oppose the plot
answers.d: She convinced all the women of the harem to petition the king against the plot

quizQuestions.question: Once the king had issued the edict against the Jews, it could not be ignored. How was Esther able to prevent the massacre of the Jews?

answers.a: She convinced the king to revoke the edict
answers.b: She convinced the king to sign another edict allowing the Jews to defend themselves
answers.c: She spread word to the Jews to go into hiding until the soldiers had passed by
answers.d: She convinced the army commanders not to enforce the edict

quizQuestions.question: Which Jewich holiday commemorates Esther's heroic acts?
Some Christians have said the book of Esther should not be in the Bible. Why?

answers.a: It was not part of the original Jewish Scriptures
answers.b: It glorifies the pagan king Xerxes
answers.c: It tends to glorify the pagan gods of the Persians

quizQuestions.question: What did Haman cause to be made?

answers.a: A banquet table for Ahasuerus and Esther

quizQuestions.question: Why was Haman full of indignation?

answers.a: His wife was not invited to the banquet
answers.b: He was not given more advance notice
answers.c: Mordecai did not stand up or move for him

answers.b: A special house built for her

answers.d: Ordered for her to be kept in jail

answers.a: She and her people were to be destroyed and slain
answers.b: The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman

answers.b: Hung to death on the gallows that he prepared for Mordecai

quizQuestions.question: What did Ahasuerus give Mordecai
